attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British troop numbers in Iraq will only be further reduced "if conditions allow", Defence Secretary Des Browne has said. Presumably, these conditions mean stability and a reduction of insurgent violence - but (and admittedly this is a lay person's view) the investment into energising Iraqi forces seems to me to be giving anti US/Uk forces the means to fight as well as the opportunitiy if armed forces are present in hostile territory.

The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to justify the planned cuts the 4,000-strong force during the next six-monthly rotation because NATO either has a policy that is safe and enforcable primarily for it's own  troops, but also then civilians, or withdraws.

War is inevitably unpopular - and so are the politicians who make decisions to take risks with the lives of others. 
  
Please reassure me that the allied agenda is still to harmonise relations between Shi'ite and Sunni Muslims, protect the world's oil supply and defend the territorial boundaries established after World War II as Jewish homeland. I urge the P.M. not to be misguided into a "peace in our time" flimsy accord, that Iraqi authorities have no intention of fulfilling.
